alert.note: Alert for Pickaway (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 3:29PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL PICKAWAY COUNTY THROUGH 400 PM EDT... At 328 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Williamsport, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Circleville, Ashville, South Bloomfield, Williamsport, Logan Elm Village, Fox, Stoutsville, Darbyville, Aw Marion State Park, East Ringgold, Deer Creek Lake, Slate Run Metro Park, State Route 207 at US Route 22, State Route 138 at US Route 22 and State Route 674 at State Route 188. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
